channel.title: Projects on Aditya Nannapaneni
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on Aditya Nannapaneni

item.title: Taxi Demand Prediction in New York City
item.description: Quick Introduction Regions obtained after clustering the latitudes/longitudes in the dataset Problem Statement: Objective: At a given time and location in NYC we want to predict the number of pickups in a 10 minutes interval. Constraints: Latency, we expect the ML model to give us the result in a few seconds. Imagine a senario where you are a cab driver in NYC, you wouldn’t want to wait 5 minutes to see the number of pickups in the region surrounding your current location.

item.title: Facebook Friend Recommendation using Graph Mining
item.description: Quick Introduction In this project we are given a dataset provided by Facebook which contains 2 features as shown below. I’ve modeled this data as a directed graph, where each row in the dataset corresponds to a connection(i.e presence of an edge) between a source node and a destination node. Here the nodes represent users in a social networking website like Facebook, Instagram and an edge represents whether they are friends or not / follow each other or not.

item.title: Quora question pair similarity
item.description: Quick Intro: Given a dataset containing question id’s, 2 questions (text format) and a binary target variable we have to predict the target variable of new questions Target Variable Mapping 0 not duplicates 1 duplicates Problem Statement: Identify which questions asked on Quora are duplicates of questions that have already been asked. This could be useful to instantly provide answers to questions that have already been answered.

item.title: Building Energy Score Prediction
item.description: Quick Intro: In this project we are given a dataset containing both numerical and categorical features pertaining to buildings in New York City and we have to come up with a model that can predict a building’s Energy Star Score (real valued target variable) Problem Statement: Use the provided building energy data to develop a model that can predict a building’s Energy Star score, and then interpret the results to find the variables that are most predictive of the score.
